alert.note: Alert for Fergus County below 4500ft; Snowy and Judith Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 4:13PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Fergus County through 500 PM MDT... At 412 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Moore, or 10 miles southwest of Lewistown, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lewistown, Moore, Glengarry, and Heath. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to ponding of water on roadways, and possibly even minor localized flooding, especially in low lying areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
